page.title: 04Linlithgow Gala Day.
page.content: The procession is made up of decorated vehicles,cars,bands and people marching behind.It starts at approximately 12 o'clock at Linlithgow Bridge and travels through the town to Linlithgow Cross.The Queen and her retinue walk down to Linlithgow Peel, where the actual crowning ceremony takes place.Many speeches are made and the traditional Gala Day song is sung. After the ceremony races and games are held in celebration of the day. The Queen and her attendants are chosen from children of the local primary schools.Some of the main characters include Britannia,Father Time,Herald and Champion.The Bower Girls,Fairies and Flower Girls add colour to the event. The town is gaily decorated with flags and a competition is held to find the best decorated arch.
